original: bcom ldan 'das gzims par gyur tam /🔽zhes smra'o // de la ngas 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzims par gyur tam / zhes smra'o // de la ngas 'di skad ces /
translated: “Has the Blessed One gone to sleep?”

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: I replied, “O man,

original: nyal bar ma gyur to zhes bka' stsal pa dang / des 'di skad ces ci lags /
analyzed: nyal bar ma gyur to zhes bka' stsal pa dang / des 'di skad ces ci lags /
translated: I have not gone to sleep.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ma gzims pa'i 'du shes kyis 'brug chems zhes mchi ba dang / thog bas pa ma gas na par gyur tam zhes smra'o //🔽de la ngas 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma gzims pa'i 'du shes kyis 'brug chems zhes mchi ba dang / thog bas pa ma gas na par gyur tam zhes smra'o // de la ngas 'di skad ces /
translated: He said, “Is it that the Blessed One has not heard the thunder and the lightning because he is not asleep?”

original: kye skyes bu nga ni mi nyal ba'i 'du shes kyis 'brug chems zhes zer ba dang / thog babs pa ma thos so zhes bka' stsal pa dang / de nas mi des 'di snyam du ji @395b srid cig nas /
analyzed: kye skyes bu nga ni mi nyal ba'i 'du shes kyis 'brug chems zhes zer ba dang / thog babs pa ma thos so zhes bka' stsal pa dang / de nas mi des 'di snyam du ji @395b srid cig nas /
translated: I replied, “O man, I have not heard the thunder and the lightning because I am not asleep.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhi bar bzhugs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhi bar bzhugs nas /
translated: Then the man thought, “Since when has the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, been in meditative equipoise?

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma gzims pa'i 'du shes kyis 'brug chems zhes zer ba dang / thog babs pa'i sgra ma gsan par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma gzims pa'i 'du shes kyis 'brug chems zhes zer ba dang / thog babs pa'i sgra ma gsan par gyur pa ni /
translated: Because the Blessed One, with the perception of being asleep, said, “Thunder is rumbling,” and did not hear the sound of lightning striking,

original: ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: it is amazing.

original: zhes bsams nas skyes bu de nga la dad par gyur cing dad pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: zhes bsams nas skyes bu de nga la dad par gyur cing dad pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Thinking this, that man became faithful to me, and out of faith,

original: 'di skad ces btsun pa bcom ldan 'das la su zhig mngon par mi dad lags /
analyzed: 'di skad ces btsun pa bcom ldan 'das la su zhig mngon par mi dad lags /
translated: he said, “Venerable One, who would not have faith in the Blessed One?

original: bdag ni 'di ltar btsun pa bcom ldan 'das la rgya cher mngon par dad lags so //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di ltar btsun pa bcom ldan 'das la rgya cher mngon par dad lags so //
translated: I have such great faith in the Blessed One, Venerable One.”

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: He said this.

original: de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung pos g-yog po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung pos g-yog po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the chief minister Yunga said to his servant,

original: kye skyes bu ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi kha dog ltar ser bzung gcig nga la byin cig dang / de ngas bcom ldan 'das la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: kye skyes bu ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi kha dog ltar ser bzung gcig nga la byin cig dang / de ngas bcom ldan 'das la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: “Hey, man, give me a new piece of cloth the color of gold, and I will offer it to the Blessed One.”

original: zhes smras nas /
analyzed: zhes smras nas /
translated: Having said this,

original: skyes bu des kyang gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po la ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi kha dog ltar ser ba zung gcig byin no //
analyzed: skyes bu des kyang gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po la ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi kha dog ltar ser ba zung gcig byin no //
translated: The man gave a pair of new, golden-colored woolen garments to Yunga, the chief minister of the wrestlers.

original: de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung pos ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser ba zung gcig khyer nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad gsol to //
analyzed: de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung pos ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser ba zung gcig khyer nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad gsol to //
translated: Then Yunga, the chief minister of the wrestlers, took a pair of new, golden-colored woolen garments and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser ba zung gcig po 'di bdag cag gi yid du mchi ba dga' ba bcang bar 'os pa de thugs brtse bar dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser ba zung gcig po 'di bdag cag gi yid du mchi ba dga' ba bcang bar 'os pa de thugs brtse bar dgongs te /
translated: “Blessed One, please accept this pair of new, golden-colored woolen garments, which we like, enjoy, and find suitable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes su gsol /
translated: Please accept them out of compassion.

original: @396a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po la thugs brtse bar dgongs nas /
analyzed: @396a *// bcom ldan 'das kyis gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po la thugs brtse bar dgongs nas /
translated: The Blessed One, out of compassion for Yunga, the chief minister of the wrestlers,🔽accepted the pair of new, golden-colored woolen garments.

original: ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser ba zung gcig bzhes pa dang / de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung pos /
analyzed: ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser ba zung gcig bzhes pa dang / de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung pos /
translated: Then Yūpa, a great wrestler, said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces bdag gis gzhan yang btsun pa bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la rim gro bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces bdag gis gzhan yang btsun pa bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la rim gro bgyi'o //
translated: “Lord, I will also serve the Blessed One and the community of monks.”

original: zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis g-yung po la dge bar smras so //🔽zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis g-yung po la dge bar smras so // zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to Yūpa, “You have spoken well.”

original: de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' ste rjes su yi rang nas /
analyzed: de nas gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' ste rjes su yi rang nas /
translated: Then Yūpa, a great wrestler, rejoiced in and praised the words of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: and then he departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po song nas ring po ma lon par mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa g-yung po song nas ring po ma lon par mkhyen nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing that Yūpa, a great wrestler, had gone away,

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: He said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser bzung gcig kha tshar dra gris chod la nga la byin cig /
analyzed: ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser bzung gcig kha tshar dra gris chod la nga la byin cig /
translated: cut the fringe off a new piece of cloth the color of gold, and give it to me.

original: ngas bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngas bgo bar bya'o //
translated: I will wear it.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser pa kha tshar dra gris bcad nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos ras bcos bu sar pa gser gyi mdog ltar ser pa kha tshar dra gris bcad nas /
translated: The venerable Ānanda cut the fringe off a new piece of cloth the color of gold,

original: bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsol to //
translated: and offered it to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One accepted it.

original: bcom @396b ldan 'das kyis gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i kha dog gsal ba ma nyams par snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom @396b ldan 'das kyis gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i kha dog gsal ba ma nyams par snang bar gyur to //
translated: When the Blessed One accepted it, the clear, undiminished color of the Blessed One’s body appeared.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa bdag gis dgung lo nyi shu lhag cig gi bar du bcom ldan 'das kyi zham 'bring na mchis na /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa bdag gis dgung lo nyi shu lhag cig gi bar du bcom ldan 'das kyi zham 'bring na mchis na /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One, “Lord, I have been attending on the Blessed One for more than twenty years,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i kha dog gsal ba 'di lta bu 'byung ba bdag gis mngon par ma 'tshal na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i kha dog gsal ba 'di lta bu 'byung ba bdag gis mngon par ma 'tshal na /
translated: “I do not understand why the Blessed One’s body has become so radiant.

original: btsun pa rgyu gang /
analyzed: btsun pa rgyu gang /
translated: Venerable One, what is the cause?

original: rkyen gang gis 'di lta bu'i sku'i kha dog gsal ba byung bar gyur /🔽kun dga' bo sku'i kha dog gsal ba 'di lta bu 'byung ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rkyen gang gis 'di lta bu'i sku'i kha dog gsal ba byung bar gyur / kun dga' bo sku'i kha dog gsal ba 'di lta bu 'byung ba 'di ni /
translated: What is the condition for this radiance of the body?”

original: rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /
translated: “Ānanda, this radiance of the body has two causes and two conditions.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gang gi nub mo byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi nub mo byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin te /
translated: The first is the night when the Bodhisattva fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and the second is the night when the Tathāgata passes into parinirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa that has no remainder of the skandhas.

original: 'di ni sku'i kha dog gsal ba 'di lta bu 'byung ba'i rgyu gnyis pa dang rkyen gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sku'i kha dog gsal ba 'di lta bu 'byung ba'i rgyu gnyis pa dang rkyen gnyis pa yin no //
translated: These are the two causes and two conditions for this radiance of the body.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo chu bo dbyig ldan ga la bar 'dong ngo //🔽bka' bzhin 'tshal /
analyzed: kun dga' bo chu bo dbyig ldan ga la bar 'dong ngo // bka' bzhin 'tshal /
translated: “Ānanda, let us go to the river Nairañjanā.”

original: zhes tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das chu bo dbyig ldan la bar gshegs te byon nas chu bo dbyig ldan gyi 'gram mtha' @397a *//
analyzed: zhes tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan to // de nas bcom ldan 'das chu bo dbyig ldan la bar gshegs te byon nas chu bo dbyig ldan gyi 'gram mtha' @397a *//
translated: “As you say, Lord,” the venerable Ānanda replied, consenting to the Blessed One’s request.🔽Then the Blessed One went to the river Nairañjanā, and having arrived, he put his Dharma robe on the bank of the river Nairañjanā

original: gcig tu na bza' chos gos bzhag ste bzhugs nas /🔽chu bo dbyig ldan gyi nang du zhugs te sku khrus legs par mdzad nas /
analyzed: gcig tu na bza' chos gos bzhag ste bzhugs nas / chu bo dbyig ldan gyi nang du zhugs te sku khrus legs par mdzad nas /
translated: and sat down.🔽Having entered the river Nairañjanā, he bathed well,

original: chu bo dbyig ldan brgal te /
analyzed: chu bo dbyig ldan brgal te /
translated: and having crossed the river Nairañjanā,

original: na bza' chos gos gcig pu dang / sku skems shing bzhugs so //
analyzed: na bza' chos gos gcig pu dang / sku skems shing bzhugs so //
translated: he sat drying his body and Dharma robe.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo mgar ba'i bu tsun da 'gyod pa skyes te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo mgar ba'i bu tsun da 'gyod pa skyes te /
translated: “Ānanda, the smith Cunda has given rise to regret.

original: gang gi phyir ston pa'i bsod snyoms phyi ma gsol bas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston pa'i bsod snyoms phyi ma gsol bas /
translated: Because the Teacher partook of his last alms,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gshegs te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gshegs te /
translated: he passed into the expanse of nirvana without remainder.

original: skul byed de ni ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: skul byed de ni ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: Cunda, that is not a gain.

original: rnyed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That is not a gain.

original: nyes pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: That is a gain of fault.

original: bde ba rnyed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That is not a gain of happiness.

original: zhes gzhan dag gis 'gyod pa bskyed kyi /
analyzed: zhes gzhan dag gis 'gyod pa bskyed kyi /
translated: Others generated regret.

original: kun dga' bo mgar ba'i bu skul byed 'gyod pa bskyed pa la gnas gnyis kyis 'gyod pa bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo mgar ba'i bu skul byed 'gyod pa bskyed pa la gnas gnyis kyis 'gyod pa bsal bar bya ste /
translated: Ānanda, in order to clear away the regret of Cunda the smith’s son, you should clear away his regret by means of two topics.

original: tsun da bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos te /
analyzed: tsun da bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos te /
translated: Cunda, I have directly heard from the Bhagavān

original: mngon sum du bzung ba ni bsod snyoms kyi rnam par smin pa mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mngon sum du bzung ba ni bsod snyoms kyi rnam par smin pa mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: and directly received that there are two types of ripening of alms, equal and unequal.

original: gang du bsod snyoms gsol nas byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang du bsod snyoms gsol nas de bzhin gshegs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: gang du bsod snyoms gsol nas byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang du bsod snyoms gsol nas de bzhin gshegs pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gshegs pa ste /
translated: and wherever, having taken his alms, the Tathagata will pass into the realm of Nirvana which leaves nothing behind,

original: 'di @397b ni bsod snyoms kyi rnam par smin pa mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa gnyis yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di @397b ni bsod snyoms kyi rnam par smin pa mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa gnyis yod pa yin no //
translated: there is the equal and unequal ripening of the alms.🔽Therefore, Ananda, this was the deed that was done and accumulated by Kanakavatsa,

original: kun dga' bo de lta bas na 'di ni mgar ba'i bu skul byed kyis las byas shing bsags pa yin te; tsher 'gyur ba dang / kha dog tu 'gyur ba dang / stobs su 'gyur ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ba dang / bde 'gror 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de lta bas na 'di ni mgar ba'i bu skul byed kyis las byas shing bsags pa yin te; tsher 'gyur ba dang / kha dog tu 'gyur ba dang / stobs su 'gyur ba dang / longs spyod du 'gyur ba dang / bde 'gror 'gyur ba dang /
translated: which will become his: the transformation of his life, the transformation of his complexion, the transformation of his strength, the transformation of his enjoyments, the transformation of his happiness,

original: phyug po 'khor dang bcas par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa yin no //
analyzed: phyug po 'khor dang bcas par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa yin no //
translated: the transformation of his wealth and retinue.

original: bar sdom ni /
analyzed: bar sdom ni /
translated: The summary:

original: tshe dang kha dog stobs dag dang // longs spyod bde 'gro phyug po rnams //
analyzed: tshe dang kha dog stobs dag dang // longs spyod bde 'gro phyug po rnams //
translated: wealth, happiness, and high birth

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos /
translated: Then the Venerable Ananda

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa 'di ni gtum po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa 'di ni gtum po /
translated: “This Venerable Chunda is a violent man,

original: gzu lums can /🔽brlang ba / gshe ba /
analyzed: gzu lums can / brlang ba / gshe ba /
translated: rash,

original: khro ba bdag cag dge slong rnams la kun tu gshe ba lags na /
analyzed: khro ba bdag cag dge slong rnams la kun tu gshe ba lags na /
translated: harsh, abusive, and angry, who is always insulting the monks.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'das pa'i 'og tu 'di ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'das pa'i 'og tu 'di ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: What should be done with him after the Blessed One has passed away?”

original: kun dga' bo dge slong 'dun pa 'di 'das pa'i 'og tu tshangs pa'i chad pas bsdig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong 'dun pa 'di 'das pa'i 'og tu tshangs pa'i chad pas bsdig par bya'o //
translated: “Ananda, after the passing of the monk Chunda, he should be threatened with the punishment of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa'i chad pas bsdigs nas kyang skyo bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i chad pas bsdigs nas kyang skyo bar bya'o //
translated: Having threatened him with the punishment of Brahma, he should be made to feel remorse.

original: de ltar kun tu skyo ba skyes nas kyang ka ta ya na la lung nod du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun tu skyo ba skyes nas kyang ka ta ya na la lung nod du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having thus made him feel remorse, he should be given the teaching on Katayana.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa; kun dga' bo grong khyer rtsva can ga la ba der 'dong ngo //🔽bka' bzhin 'tshal /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa; kun dga' bo grong khyer rtsva can ga la ba der 'dong ngo // bka' bzhin 'tshal /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, “Ānanda, let us go to the city of Kuśinagarī.”

original: zhes tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan to //
analyzed: zhes tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan to //
translated: “Yes, Blessed One,” the venerable Ānanda replied, consenting to the Blessed One’s request.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das @398a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das @398a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One

original: gyad kyi ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
analyzed: gyad kyi ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
translated: traveled through the country of the Mallas

original: grong khyer rtsva can gyi bar dang / chu bo dbyig ldan gyi bar du shul du zhugs te gshegs pa las shul nas gyu ste /
analyzed: grong khyer rtsva can gyi bar dang / chu bo dbyig ldan gyi bar du shul du zhugs te gshegs pa las shul nas gyu ste /
translated: and entered the road between the city of Kuśinagarī and the river Hiraṇyavatī.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He then said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo nga rgyab mi bde ste ngal bsos /
analyzed: kun dga' bo nga rgyab mi bde ste ngal bsos /
translated: “Ānanda, my back hurts and I am tired.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla gos bzhi ltab tu ltobs la thing zhig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla gos bzhi ltab tu ltobs la thing zhig /
translated: Fold the Tathāgata’s outer robe into four layers and give it to me.”

original: tha ma'i gzims mal nas byung nas /
analyzed: tha ma'i gzims mal nas byung nas /

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang /
translated: and went to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: dri za'i rgyal po rab dga'i sgo na bzhugs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //

analyzed: dri za'i rgyal po rab dga' yang gang nga lta bu ni med do //

original: zhes dri za'i rgyal po rab dga' dregs par gyur te /
analyzed: zhes dri za'i rgyal po rab dga' dregs par gyur te /

original: des pi wang snyan pa snyan pa blangs nas yid rab tu dga' bar gyur cing 'dug go /
analyzed: des pi wang snyan pa snyan pa blangs nas yid rab tu dga' bar gyur cing 'dug go /
translated: He played his beautiful lute and sat there with great joy.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo srung gi skyes bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo srung gi skyes bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

original: kva'e skyes bu song la /🔽dri za'i rgyal po rab dga' la sgo khar dri za zhig shes ldan blta ba'i phyir 'ongs so //
analyzed: kva'e skyes bu song la / dri za'i rgyal po rab dga' la sgo khar dri za zhig shes ldan blta ba'i phyir 'ongs so //

analyzed: zhes byos shig /

original: de song nas smras pa dang / de dregs pas myos nas smras pa /
analyzed: de song nas smras pa dang / de dregs pas myos nas smras pa /
translated: “Very well,” he replied, and went to tell him.🔽The gandharva king was intoxicated with pride and said,

original: kva'e ci zer /
analyzed: kva'e ci zer /
translated: “What?

original: ci nga las gzhan pa'i dri za yang yod dam /
analyzed: ci nga las gzhan pa'i dri za yang yod dam /

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /

original: gzhan dag lta re zhig smos kyang ci 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag lta re zhig smos kyang ci 'tshal gyi /

original: sgo drung 'di kho na na mchis lags so //
analyzed: sgo drung 'di kho na na mchis lags so //
translated: He is right here at the door.”

original: dri za de dregs pas myos pa'i shugs kyis mod la sgor byung ste /
analyzed: dri za de dregs pas myos pa'i shugs kyis mod la sgor byung ste /
translated: The gandharva king’s pride was so great that he immediately went out the door.

original: des smras @424a *//
analyzed: des smras @424a *//
translated: “Hey, man,” he said,

original: pa; kva'e skyes bu khyod dri za yin nam /
analyzed: pa; kva'e skyes bu khyod dri za yin nam /
translated: “are you a gandharva?”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / kva'e nga dri za te por yin no // des smras pa /
translated: “Yes, I am,” the Blessed One replied.

original: gal te de lta na glu dbyangs blang gi tshur shog /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gal te de lta na glu dbyangs blang gi tshur shog / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Well, then,” the gandharva said, “sing a song. Come on!”

original: kva'e legs kyi de bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: kva'e legs kyi de bzhin bya'o //
translated: “Very well,” the Blessed One said, “I will do just that.”

original: zhes ji tsam bcom ldan 'das dang / de lhan cig 'gran to //
analyzed: zhes ji tsam bcom ldan 'das dang / de lhan cig 'gran to //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud gcig bcad pa dang / des kyang rgyud gcig bcad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud gcig bcad pa dang / des kyang rgyud gcig bcad de /

analyzed: pi wang gnyis ka'i rgyud dang / sgra mnyam mo //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud gnyis bcad pa dang / de bzhin du sgra dang gdangs khyad par med do //

original: de bzhin du gsum pa dang / bzhi pa nas rgyud gcig pa'i bar du bzhag pa dang / rab dgas kyang gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa nas rgyud gcig pa'i bar du gzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum pa dang / bzhi pa nas rgyud gcig pa'i bar du bzhag pa dang / rab dgas kyang gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa nas rgyud gcig pa'i bar du gzhag ste /
translated: Likewise, he placed three, four, up to all the strings, and Subhadra also placed two, three, four, up to all the strings.

analyzed: de bzhin du pi wang gnyis ka skad dang / gdangs khyad par med do //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud gcig pa yang bcad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud gcig pa yang bcad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One cut all the strings,

analyzed: nam mkha' kho na la yang sgra dang gdangs de bzhin du gyur pa dang / dri za'i rgyal po rab dga' ngo mtshar skyes nas nga rgyal gyis dregs pa med par gyur nas /
translated: The gandharva king Pramudita, amazed, became free of pride and arrogance.

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

analyzed: bdag pas 'phags pa'i dri za gzhan yang yod pa lta snyam mo //
translated: “There are other gandharvas who are superior to me.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dri za'i cha byad mi snang bar mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One made the gandharva form disappear.

translated: The Blessed One was endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks,

analyzed: sku nyi ma stong gi 'od bas lhag pa'i 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
translated: his body adorned with a light that surpassed the radiance of a thousand suns,

original: rin po che'i ri ltar kun nas bzang ba /
analyzed: rin po che'i ri ltar kun nas bzang ba /
translated: beautiful in every way like a mountain of jewels,🔽and he was sitting in his own body.

analyzed: rang gi sku nyid du bzhugs pa dang / dri za'i rgyal po rab dgas mthong ste de dad pa skyes nas /
translated: Pramudita, the gandharva king, saw him and, filled with faith,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: he bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One.

analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir spyan snga na 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin mkhyen nas /
translated: The Blessed One, knowing his thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature,

analyzed: des 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bshad de /

analyzed: gang thos pas dri za'i rgyal po rab dgas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /
translated: and through which the gandharva king Subhadra destroyed with the vajra of knowledge the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection,

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas nas /
translated: and actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: des bden pa mthong ste /
analyzed: des bden pa mthong ste /
translated: Then he saw the truths.

original: lan gsum du ched du brjod pas ched du brjod pa /
analyzed: lan gsum du ched du brjod pas ched du brjod pa /
translated: He spoke an inspired utterance three times:

analyzed: btsun pa 'di lta bu ni bdag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: “Reverend, this has not been done for me by my father,

analyzed: mas kyang ma lags /

original: rgyal pos kyang ma lags /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang ma lags /
translated: or by the king,

original: lhas ma lags /
analyzed: lhas ma lags /
translated: or by gods,

analyzed: mdza' bos ma lags / rang gi skye bo dang gnyen gyi tshogs kyis ma lags /
translated: or by yakṣas,🔽or by gandharvas,🔽or by mahoragas,🔽or by renunciants and brahmins,

original: sngon gyi 'das pas ma lags /
analyzed: sngon gyi 'das pas ma lags /
translated: or by beings such as gods and humans.

analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyis ma lags pa gang lags pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed One has done for me what no ascetic or brahmin could do.

original: khrag dang mchi ma'i rgya mtsho ni bskams /
analyzed: khrag dang mchi ma'i rgya mtsho ni bskams /

analyzed: rus pa'i ri bo las ni bsgral /

original: ngan song gi sgo dag ni bkum /
analyzed: ngan song gi sgo dag ni bkum /

analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa'i sgo dag ni phye ste / bdag lha dang mi'i @425a *//
translated: and opened the doors to the higher realms and liberation.

original: gnas su bzhag pas /
analyzed: gnas su bzhag pas /
translated: He has placed me in the realms of gods and humans.

analyzed: dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol deng slan chad nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gcod pa las log ste /

analyzed: mngon par dad nas skyabs su mchi lags so // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dri za'i rgyal po rab dga' la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: and with deep faith, I go for refuge.”🔽Then the Blessed One, with a discourse on the Dharma, instructed, inspired,

analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: enthused, and delighted the gandharva king Pramudita.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and he rejoiced.

analyzed: ji ltar thugs mnyam par bzhag na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang nas mi snang bar gyur cing /
translated: Then, in a state of concentration, he disappeared from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three

analyzed: tha ma'i gzims mal du bzhugs pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: and entered the final absorption of his life.

analyzed: de'i tshe grong khyer rtsva can na /

analyzed: kun tu rgyu rab bzang zhes bya ba / rgas pa / rnyings pa /
translated: there was a wandering mendicant named Subhadra,🔽who was old, aged, and decrepit, a hundred and twenty years old.

original: 'khogs pa / lo brgya nyi shu lon pa de la grong khyer rtsva can gyi gyad rnams kyis bkur stir byed /🔽bla mar byed /
analyzed: 'khogs pa / lo brgya nyi shu lon pa de la grong khyer rtsva can gyi gyad rnams kyis bkur stir byed / bla mar byed /
translated: The Mallas of Kuśinagarī honored him,

original: ri mor byed /
analyzed: ri mor byed /
translated: held him in high esteem,

original: mchod par byed de /
analyzed: mchod par byed de /
translated: and venerated him.

original: de dgra bcom par grags pa zhig gnas so //
analyzed: de dgra bcom par grags pa zhig gnas so //
translated: He was known as an arhat.

original: grong khyer rtsa can na rdzing dal gyis 'bab pa'i 'gram au du ma w'a ra'i tshal gyi drung na /
analyzed: grong khyer rtsa can na rdzing dal gyis 'bab pa'i 'gram au du ma w'a ra'i tshal gyi drung na /
translated: In the city of Kuśinagarī, at the edge of the river Kakutthā, in the Upavattana grove,

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug la @425b lan gsum du sbyang ba mdzad nas /
translated: He purified the six types of gods of the desire realm three times,

original: glang po che ltar bstan te /
analyzed: glang po che ltar bstan te /
translated: and then descended like an elephant.

original: yum gyi lhums su zhugs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yum gyi lhums su zhugs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When he entered his mother's womb,

original: au dum w'a ra'i tshal sbal mig thon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: au dum w'a ra'i tshal sbal mig thon par 'gyur ro //
translated: the udumbara grove sprouted eyes.

analyzed: gang gi tshe yum gyi lhums nas byung ba de'i tshe sbal mig bye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he emerged from his mother's womb, those eyes opened.

original: gang gi tshe gzhon nu rol pas rol pa de'i tshe me tog kha 'bus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhon nu rol pas rol pa de'i tshe me tog kha 'bus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he enjoyed youthful play, those flowers bloomed.

original: gang gi tshe rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba gzigs te thugs byung nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba gzigs te thugs byung nas /
translated: When he saw old age, sickness, and death, became disgusted,

original: dka' thub kyi nags tshal du zhugs pa de'i tshe me tog kha bye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dka' thub kyi nags tshal du zhugs pa de'i tshe me tog kha bye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and entered the forest of austerities, those flowers fully bloomed.

original: gang gi tshe dka' ba spyod pa de'i tshe me tog kha bye ba rnyings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dka' ba spyod pa de'i tshe me tog kha bye ba rnyings par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he was practicing austerities, the opened flowers withered.

translated: When he knew that his austerities were pointless, he ate as much porridge and rice as he wanted, breathed as he wanted, and relaxed as he wanted.

original: sku til mar dang / mar sar gyis byugs te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sku til mar dang / mar sar gyis byugs te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He anointed his body with sesame oil and then bathed in the Nairañjanā River.

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /

original: de'i tshe me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, all the flowers opened.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pas gsol te /🔽yul w'a ra n'a sir gshegs nas lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pas gsol te / yul w'a ra n'a sir gshegs nas lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: When Brahmā requested the Blessed One,🔽“Go to the land of Vārāṇasī and turn the wheel of Dharma🔽three times and in twelve aspects,”

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: au dum w'a ra'i tshal lham me lhan ne lhang nger 'gyur ro //
analyzed: au dum w'a ra'i tshal lham me lhan ne lhang nger 'gyur ro //
translated: The grove of udumbara trees became radiant, clear, and bright.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs gang dang / gang dag na grong dang / grong khyer dang / @426a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs gang dang / gang dag na grong dang / grong khyer dang / @426a *//
translated: Whenever the Blessed One had tamed the disciples in a certain region, a certain town, a certain city,

original: yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / ljongs de dang de dag tu gdul ba rnams btul te /
analyzed: yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang / ljongs de dang de dag tu gdul ba rnams btul te /
translated: a certain district, a certain royal palace, or a certain country,

original: grong khyer rtsva can du tha ma'i gzims mal du bzhugs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: grong khyer rtsva can du tha ma'i gzims mal du bzhugs pa de'i tshe /
translated: he would then go to the town of Kūṣinagarī for his final rest.🔽When that happened, the entire grove of udumbara trees would wither.

original: au dum w'a ra'i tshal rnyings par 'gyur ba de thams cad kun tu rgyu rab bzang gis mtshan mar byas pa dang / grong khyer rtsva can na gnas pa'i lha zhig gis /
analyzed: au dum w'a ra'i tshal rnyings par 'gyur ba de thams cad kun tu rgyu rab bzang gis mtshan mar byas pa dang / grong khyer rtsva can na gnas pa'i lha zhig gis /
translated: The wandering sage Subhadra took this as an omen, and a god who lived in the town of Kūṣinagarī

original: grong khyer rtsva can pa la de bzhin gshegs pa ni deng gi nam gyi gung thun la phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grong khyer rtsva can pa la de bzhin gshegs pa ni deng gi nam gyi gung thun la phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: told the people of Kūṣinagarī, “The Thus-Gone One will pass into parinirvāṇa tonight, in the middle of the night, in the realm of nirvāṇa that has no remainder of the skandhas.”

original: zhes smras pa de kun tu rgyu rab bzang gis thos so //
analyzed: zhes smras pa de kun tu rgyu rab bzang gis thos so //
translated: The wandering mendicant Subhadra heard all this.
